title: Frog Eye Salad Recipe
description: Frog eye salad is a chilled sweet dessert made with small pasta, pineapple, Mandarin oranges, coconut, and marshmallows combined in a creamy pineapple dressing.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Specialty Dessert Recipes Dessert Salad Recipes Frog Eye Salad 4.7 (323) 261 Reviews 8 Photos This frog eye salad is made with acini di pepe (or couscous) pasta, coconut, pineapple, mandarin oranges, and marshmallows for a sweet, chilled holiday dessert. Submitted by Judy Awe Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 9 hrs Total Time: 9 hrs 35 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 ¾ cups unsweetened pineapple juice 1 cup white sugar 2 large eggs, beaten 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2 ½ teaspoons salt, divided 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 (16 ounce) package acini di pepe pasta 3 (11 ounce) cans mandarin oranges, drained 2 (20 ounce) cans pineapple tidbits, drained 1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed 1 cup miniature marshmallows 1 cup shredded coconut Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine pineapple juice, sugar, eggs, flour, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a saucepan. Stir and cook over medium heat until thickened. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add oil and remaining 2 teaspoons salt. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine cooked pasta, cooled egg mixture, mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, crushed pineapple, and whipped topping in a large bowl; mix well. Refrigerate until chilled, 8 hours to overnight. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Before serving, add marshmallows and coconut; toss and serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 640 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 581 Calories 11g Fat 114g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 581 % Daily Value * Total Fat 11g 14% Saturated Fat 7g 37% Cholesterol 37mg 12% Sodium 648mg 28% Total Carbohydrate 114g 41% Dietary Fiber 4g 14% Total Sugars 75g Protein 9g 17% Vitamin C 30mg 33% Calcium 55mg 4% Iron 3mg 18% Potassium 388mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Frog Eye Salad 01 of 08 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 08 Photo by  RedRedus77 08/20/2017 03 of 08 Photo by  zygomatic 11/27/2014 I used coconut sugar instead of white sugar. And left out the whip cream and marshmallows. Our family and friends loved it! This has been a holiday traditional meal for years. 04 of 08 Photo by  Josephine Roeper 05/26/2014 Tasted very close to what the church luncheon ladies make but something was missing. :( 05 of 08 Photo by  Darcey55 12/02/2009 06 of 08 Photo by  5boys2cook4 04/21/2009 I love this stuff! This is almost the same recipe that I've made for years. The only differences are that mine calls for 1/2 pkg of pasta to the amount of sauce shown here. So, If following this recipe, I would double the sauce. Also I never add this much fruit. I prefer it with less. I use 2 cans of mandarin oranges and one large can of pineapple tidbits. I drain the juice from these and use it for the sauce. Sometimes I skip the marshmallows, It's plenty sweet without. 07 of 08 Photo by  larkspur 03/11/2009 My family loves this salad! I did omit the marshmallows and the coconut; the salad is sweet enough without those additions! The ingredients may sound strange, but this is a very tasty recipe! Thanks for sharing! 08 of 08 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 06/17/2006 1 You’ll Also Love Holiday Ambrosia Salad 28 Ratings Rosa Marina Fruit Salad 31 Ratings Acini di Pepe Salad 133 Ratings Pistachio Fluff Salad 360 Ratings Auntie Midge's Hawaiian Salad 23 Ratings Strawberry Ambrosia 18 Ratings Cookie Salad 128 Ratings Easy Frog Eye Salad 3 Ratings Ambrosia Salad with Fruit Cocktail 4 Ratings Creamy Cookie Salad 4 Ratings Fruit Salad 107 Ratings Marshmallow and Fruit Salad 6 Ratings Orange Cream Fruit Salad 458 Ratings Heavenly Pink Salad 112 Ratings Grandma's Five Cup Salad 158 Ratings Coconut Ambrosia Salad 365 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
